result.title: Objective
result.description: To promote and facilitate sustainable development and management of the Havana Bay by the implementation of innovative approaches for reducing the input of priority international waters contaminants.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

actual.comment:
2006 2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012 2013 2014 2015
N (mg/l) 0.137 0.094 0.050 0.0852 0.1410 0.1045 0.1222 0.1666 0,1778 0,2128
P (mg/l) 0.068 0.093 0.077 0.1250 0.1333 0.1060 0.1162 0.1497 0,1209 0,1581
This information was obtained through the Environmental Monitoring System for the Havana Bay, which provides as a systematic task, monitoring key indicators of ecosystem´s quality. The objectives of this monitoring are to define the current level of pollution in the Bay and its evolution due to control and mitigation measures of pollution that have been implemented.
This information merely aims to provide a snapshot of the current ecosystem status.
The results of the ammonium nitrogen showed an increase in the three measurement levels compared to the previous years.
In the case of the concentration’s total phosphorus, the results were higher than the previous years in surface and middle level. This indicator shows a slight tendency to the increase in the superficial level, however in the middle and bottom level the tendency is to decrease.
The annual average concentrations of ammonia nitrogen (N-NH4) at all measurement levels were higher than 3.57 mol L-1, which is the minimum limit for considering the poor quality water according to the Cuban Standard NC 25: 1999 for the assessment of water resources for fishery.
The average concentrations of total phosphorus (PT) in the superficial level were higher than 2.5 mol L-1, considered as indicative inferior limit of eutrophic systems corresponding to the Cuban Standard mentioned above.
The nutrients increased with respect to the previous year, and a tendency to the slight increase is observed in the last four years.
The concentrations of nutrients in general continue high.
Long-term sustainability of all measures to rehabilitate the bay is of great importance, as well as the continuity of the implemented environmental monitoring system.
The entry into operation of the wastewater treatment plant Luyano IV and the others wastewaters treatment plants which are in construction at the moment in the tributary basin of the bay, will contribute to decrease the nutrient concentrations in the Havana bay.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: The demonstration plant is established thus reducing nutrients to Havana Bay and the Wider Caribbean.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

actual.comment: All designs and plans completed in 2006

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

actual.comment: The purchase and the delivery of the plant technology was completed in 2007

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

actual.comment:
This project´s outcome has reached 78% of implementation.
During the period, several actions aimed at the WTP Luyanó IV´s finalization have been carried out.
the completion of 34 objects has continued (Inlet registry, main pumping station, pretreatment building, sand remover/degreaser, flow meter, distribution chamber, primary settlers 1 and 2, collection chamber, anoxic chamber, aerobic reactors - secondary settlers 1 and 2, overflow registers R-1 and R-2, air producing facility, contact tank-water reuse, chlorination building, primary sludge pumping station (including sludge and supernatant), secondary sludge pumping station (including recirculation and excess), sludge thickener, thickened sludge pumping station, anaerobic digester, digested sludge pumping station, internal sewage system, garage facility, control facility, potable water tank, external electrical networks, perimeter fencing, internal vials , external areas, laboratory – administrative facility), a total of 46 were planned for this stage, advancing to different phases of completion, in line with the approved schedule. (In the new schedule, the objects of PTR Luyanó IV´s civil works are more particularized, according to its functions).

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

target.comment: Plans for operation, maintenance and monitoring under execution.

actual.comment:
The operation and maintenance programs of WTP Luyanó IV are being developed by the National Institute of Hydraulic Resources (INRH).
During the stage has prepared the operation and maintenance programs of WTP Luyanó IV, but it is not concluded yet, due to modifications of the WTP Luyanó IV ´s executive project which are been carrying out, directed to obtain improvements in the future operation of this treatment system.
The conclusion’s operation and maintenance programs of the WTP Luyanó IV´ , have been systematically supervised in the controlled of the work.
The monitoring program, that will be implemented when the WTP Luyanó IV becomes operational, has been already prepared by the Centre for Engineering and Environmental Management of Bays (CIMAB). This program will demonstrate the fulfillment of the project’s main objective and will allow to assess the WTP Luyanó IV’s environmental impact in the Havana Bay rehabilitation.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

actual.comment:
The number of kilometers of the large diameter collectors systems installed and in operation remains at 6, 5 km. (90% of progress).
Currently, we have been working on the executive project for the entrance siphon of the WTP Luyanó IV to proceed to its construction.
The collectors systems will be concluded in 2016, according to the established chronogram.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

actual.comment: During the period have been maintained a population of 60,000 inhabitants connected to the WTP Luyanó IV ´s sewer collection system, preserving the environmental and living condition’s improvement of the population served.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

target.comment: Stakeholders consultation and awareness raising strategy designed and implemented

actual.comment:
During the stage, the socialization, dissemination and awareness program of the project was updated, with the essential purpose of ensuring the visibility of the project´s objectives, the progress of the planned outcomes, as well as, the impact of all actions performed to achieve the purposes of the project.
A systematic upgrade about the project´s progress to different audiences like municipal environmental commissions, specialists from the Ministry of Science, Technology and Environment (CITMA) in the municipalities whose communities are involved, the media and population in general, has continued
The socialization, dissemination and awareness project´s activities that have been implemented, were directed to ensure that the population of the intervened areas know about the project’s actions to achieve the continuous improvement of environmental quality of the Habana Bay´s ecosystem , as well as , increase awareness and educate the inhabitants of these areas in the importance of environmental sanitation and conservation of the Luyanó river and Havana Bay, and the actions which the community can carry out to contribute to the effect.
The implemented and planned measures for the mitigation of the negative environmental impacts which can be generated in the PTR Luyanó IV´s operation have also been reported.
Educational activities designed to preserve the outcomes, achievements, quality of the executed works and its sustainability have been promoted by municipal environmental commissions, municipal, provincial and Bay State Working Group of Havana of CITMA specialists, various entities of the National Institute of Hydraulic Resources (INRH), Municipal Education and Culture and the Media, .
The project has continued having diffusion in all the spaces related with the environmental management and the rehabilitation of the Havana´s Bay, through local, national and regional media (radio and television), magazines and newspapers (Pelicano, Granma, Juventud Rebelde, Tribuna, Trabajadores, Somos Jovenes, www. habanaradio.cu. www radiococo. icrt. cu, ), national and international events, confirming the need and importance of WTP Luyano´s IV for the Havana bay ‘s rehabilitation
Dissemination materials with different experiences, achievements and challenges of the Environmental Management in the Bay of Havana were published by the state working group of the Havana´s Bay.

indicator.title: Indicator 8
indicator.description: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

target.comment: The best alternative has been selected and the reuse of the sludge is under process.

actual.comment:
The National Institute of Hydraulic Resources (INRH) have been working in the valuations of alternatives for the sludge´s use.
A process of coordinations and involvement of Ministry of the Agriculture (MINAGRI), for analyzing the potentialities of sludge´s use in the agriculture, as well as providing policies and regulations which the sludge for these uses must comply.
A contract has been signed by the WTP Luyanó IV´s Investor with CIMAB to perform a new physical - chemical characterization of wastewater which will be treated in the WTP Luyanó IV, including heavy metal’s indicators.
This characterization will facilitate a better understanding of the characteristics of the sludge that will be produced in the WTP Luyanó IV.
This indicator has been systematically supervised in the WTP Luyanó IV´s controls during this period.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Demonstration projects focusing on recycling of nutrients and energy from waste and wastewater

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

target.comment: Water saving toilets and separation of black-water/grey-water installed and working properly.

actual.comment: The zero emission building is totally inhabited and in exploitation. The separate hydraulic systems for grey and black waters are functioning. The water saving toilets have been operating. Currently, the vacuum pump (for running vacuum toilets) is out of order. This situation has not resolved yet and has continued operating with the traditional alternative installed in the 8 apartments with vacuum toilets.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

target.comment: The program for technology transfer executed.

actual.comment: The technology transfer program has been executed. The separate treatment of black and gray water has been implemented and operating, including the installation and operation of the saving toilets

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

target.comment: The Wetland System developed and under use

actual.comment: The wetland is operating satisfactorily with subsequent reuse of treated water

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

target.comment: The program for survey, monitoring and research established.

actual.comment:
The proposal of the environmental, social and economic impacts assessment of the demonstrative project The Zero Emission building , basedin the operative experience, and including the characterization´s treated wastewaters was presented by the CTDMC to the National Office Project (Provincial Delegation of CITMA in Havana city, for it approval.
This proposal was evaluated and approved by the Delegation CITMA in Havana, including these studies in the project´s planning in 2016.
These studies will allow to know if the implementation of this demonstrative experience is feasible in other towns of the province or the country (in sensitive areas from the environmental ´s point of view, example: with deficit of water supply, urbanizations which don't possess and/or don't admit construction´s local sewer system systems, communities which are distant from the municipal wastewater treatment systems)
This evaluation will contribute to the Final evaluation and Report of the Project

actual.comment: The situation is the same as reported last year, referring to the end of the project.

indicator.title: Indicator 8

actual.comment: The situation is the same as reported last year, referring to the end of the project.

indicator.title: Indicator 9
indicator.description: 3. Area of seascape within SCE benefiting from biodiversity friendly management by productive sectors (sustainable fisheries)

actual.comment: 3510 km2. The area of seascape benefiting with additional pilot projects in execution. This target of direct benefit has been over accomplished

indicator.title: Indicator 10
indicator.description: 4. Area within SCE affected benefiting indirectly over the long term by changed productive sectors:

indicator.title: Indicator 11
indicator.description: 4.1. Landscape

actual.comment: Landscape: 2 7,87 7.74 Km2 (10, 597.74 km2 have been certified as under Integrated Coastal Management (ICM) by the National Environmental Authority, plus 17,280.00 km2 corresponding to the total area of the 20 municipalities where awareness raising related to ICM is implemented. The target has been over-accomplished.

indicator.title: Indicator 12
indicator.description: 4.2. Seascape

actual.comment:
The area within SCE affected benefiting indirectly over the long term by changes in productive sectors is all its marine area, it means, 8311 km2, value recognized since Phase 1 of the Project and foreseen as the target to be accomplished at the end of Project, in this indicator
The wrong figure of 22800 km2was an oversight of mixing-up the word “water-shed” (that is terrestrial: Cuenca hidrográfica) as“marine-shelf” (plataforma marina) in information consulted when doing calculations. For that reason, in the year 2012 a big land area was added wrongly and unnoticed to the sea area, and subsequently considered as an over accomplishment. The mistake was kept unaware in 2013 and 2014 years given that the mentioned area was considered the whole potential marine territory to be involved in the project. Anyway, it does not change the real fact that the whole marine area covered by the project has been benefited directly or indirectly since 2012, so that the goal was accomplished.
It is explained by the great sea connectivity by water exchange among water bodies, and by passive transport of larvae as well as by active transport of juveniles and adults of species that are relevant to fisheries, that within the SCE move from and toward areas that receive direct benefits from zones where demonstrative sustainable practices taken place. Total elimination of bottom trawling and set nets in 2012 and 2008, respectively, contributes to increase indirect benefits. In the other hand, the situation is favorable due to the total area established as fisheries reserves that is higher than the initially considered.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Outcome 1: A strengthened enabling environment will exist for the financial, institutional, environmental and social sustainability of biodiversity conservation in the tourism, fisheries and agriculture / livestock sectors in the SCE.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1. % of hotels in ecologically sensitive areas within the SCE that are built according to planning guidelines that have incorporated biodiversity conservation recommendations (developed during project by tourism sector).

actual.comment:
100%. In each key of the Sabana Camaguey Archipelago, the new hotels are built in those spaces, and with the approved load capacity, according to the Master Plans for Tourism Development in these territories. These Master Plans are based in Project recommendations during its Phase 1, and according to these recommendations, in the rest of the territory, which constitutes the largest area of the keys and where the highest biodiversity values are concentrated, investment of tourism infrastructure are not allowed.
However, during this PIR period, the Project has been consulted because of investors have requested to increase the number of rooms to be constructed at the western zone of the archipelago. The disagreement has been exposed by the Project, through the CITMA, at national technical meeting where these issues are discussed under the leadership of the National Institute of Physical Planning. In a certain measure these disagreement have been taking into account due to if the ecosystem load capacity is increased over the total of rooms by this key recommended by the project, great biodiversity affectations can be expected.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Outcome 2: The tourism sector develops in accordance with the conservation of marine and terrestrial ecosystems within the SCE.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: 1. % of new hotels in ecologically sensitive areas within the SCE that are planned with specific guidelines for biodiversity conservation in the following categories:

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: 1.1. With liquid waste treatment systems (tertiary treatment plants)

actual.comment: 100%. It is established by the sector to use only tertiary treatment in installations located at the Archipelago

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: 1.2. Use of native vegetation in gardens and landscaping

actual.comment: 100% The new hotels used native plants in part of their gardening (in the keys).

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: 2. Percentage of visitors to the SCE participating in nature related activities

actual.comment: (0.15) 15%. This figure has continued increasing, basically in La Redonda lagoon and Jobo Rosado Protected Area with the participation of national and foreign visitors

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: 3. Increase in the percentage of tourist packages that offer alternative models to â€œsun and sandâ€

actual.comment: 0.09 (9%). Increase of alternative tourist packages had continued slight in this period

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: 4. # of new roads built following biodiversity friendly construction guidelines in ecologically sensitive areas

actual.comment: The National Standard Project's proposals, about road design continues in process. Their content continue in discussion among the main sectors involved with their objectives. These are environmental, transportation, construction and Universities linked to Engineering and Architecture of the whole country . Approval of a National Standard is a long process but it is an effective way to ensure that results of any Project are accomplished. Even though, the Project is finished this process it is continued by CITMA as the governmental institution responsible to put in force all the environmental standard. This standard through the CITMA was proposed and initiated.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: 5. Decrease in coral reef mortality from diving activity

actual.comment: The situation is the same as reported last year, referring to the end of the project.

indicator.title: Indicator 8
indicator.description: 6. Revenues from taxes and fees on tourism activities invested in biodiversity conservation within the SCE

actual.comment: The proposal of mechanisms was concluded. It is based on willingness to pay which would involve charging tour operators a fee that would revert back to addressing these issues. This mechanism is a significant promoter tool within the economic Cuban context. The Project had delivered the results obtained and their scientific basis. As is known, mechanisms and legal instruments to ensure the long-term financing of BD integration in tourism require decisions out of the Project scopes. At present time, this financial tool, together with other addressed to biodiversity conservation is being evaluated by the CITMA. All these are components of financial environmental policies that in a short time should be implemented as a part reviewing of the economic model currently taking place in the country

location.name: Pinar del Río

result.title: Objective
result.description: The effectiveness and efficiency of SLM initiatives in Cuba is maximized programme-wide

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Proportion of the core target group of 25 key institutions nationwide which is participating in the coordinated and integrated use of lands based on sustainable land management principles

target.comment:
18 members of the core target group by end of year 7
25 members of the core target group by end of Program

actual.comment:
38 institutions are participating in the implementation of the CPP. During this last period 8 new institutions over the reported until June 30, 2014 were added due to: start the project CPP 2; beginning of the preparation stage of the Project Document project CPP 3; and the extension of the actions of SLM across the country.
The new entities are: UMA Holguín, UMA Tunas, UMA Stgo. De Cuba, UMA Ciego de Ávila, UMA I. Juventud, Univ. Pedagógica Villa Clara, Univ. PR, IPU Villena Revolución.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Proportion of area covered by CPP where agreements for coordination between national, provincial and municipal authorities for the use of lands based on sustainable land management principles are developed and in place

baseline.comment: No systems exist specific to SLM

target.comment: 50% of national territory covered by agreements by year 5, 70% by year 8 and 80% by year 10

actual.comment: The 54.2 % of national territory. In this last period actions on SLM were replicated in 91 municipalities outside the CPP Intervention Areas. (45 additional municipalities, relative to the previous period).

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Institutions coordinate their SLM initiatives effectively programme-wide

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Number of CPP projects whose startup responds to the achievement of milestones identified in the CPP document

target.comment: 5 (100%), throughout the life of the CPP

actual.comment: 3 Projects (60%). Project 5 are under implementation. Project 1 is concluded implementation, final evaluation was satisfactory. Project 2 is implemented since May 12, 2015. The project 3 continues in its development phase PRODOC.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Number of constituent projects within the CPP which meet their impact targets in a cost-effective manner

target.comment: 80%, throughout the life of the CPP

actual.comment:
91 % (average CPP-5 & CPP-P1). CPP-5 met its impact targets to 83%, CPP-1 met its impact targets to 99%, and CPP-2 is starting its implementation, since it began in May 2015. CPP-P1 technically he closed in November 2014 and financially closed in November 2015, and done the objectives proposed by the project. The CPP-2 formally began to be implemented from the inception workshop, all actions related to their stage of PPG were fulfilled successfully and satisfactorily PRODOC was approved.
CPP-3 is in the development phase of the PRODOC. Also the preparation stage PRODOC, the drafting of logical framework, and the letter CEO; the work plan and procurement plan of the PPG stage was realized. All this demonstrates a good relation cost-effective of CPP projects.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Degree of coincidence between activity targets established in annual work plans of CPP and constituent projects, and actual execution

target.comment: 90%, throughout the life of the CPP

actual.comment: Degree of coincidence between activity targets established in annual work plans of CPP 94.6% and constituent projects, and actual execution: (Project 1 - 98%; project 2 - 90.0% and Project 5 - 95.9%)

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Degree of coincidence between financial targets established in annual budgets of CPP and constituent projects, and actual execution.

target.comment: 90%, throughout the life of the CPP

actual.comment: Degree of coincidence between financial targets established in annual budgets of CPP : 98.4% and constituent projects, and actual execution: Project 1 -97.3%; Project 2 -100%; project 5 99.4%. (P1- GEF funds execution 97.3%+ co financing execution 281.4% total execution P1 265.2%; P2- GEF funds execution 100%+ co financing execution 191.6% total execution P2 - 147.6%; P5 - GEF funds execution 99.4%+ co financing execution GoC 85.4%, total execution P5 91.9 %)

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Proportion of planned CPP staff and institutional staff seconded to projects in place and satisfying performance requirements

baseline.comment: 5 full time and 3 part time members of the central team

target.comment: 100% (6 full time and 6 part time staff of the central team, 4 project leaders and 5 intervention area staff)

actual.comment: 93% . The Central Coordination Unit has undergone some changes at this stage and has been strengthened with other 5 members. So 13 full-time members and two part-time are counted. Organized: A director of CPP, a specialist and a financial technique, 6 SLM specialists, one designer, one computer scientist and two drivers (full time). 2 Specialists for Handling Units

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Number of national and international institutions (both within and outside the CPP), which coordinate with and complement GEF-funded investments in the CPP in their initiatives and plans related to SLM

target.comment:
All 25 members of the core target group, all 46 key collaborating institutions
and 4 international agencies

actual.comment: 42 institutions. At this stage we add another 3 national institutions and continue relations with UNEP, FAO, UNDP. We held a second exchange with IADIZA in Mendoza, Argentina and began sharing experiences with specialists and producers of ABE (Mangrove) and JAICA (south of Havana) projects and strengthening the experiences with basal and PVR projects.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Proportion of local stakeholders in area covered by CPP who are satisfied with CPP decisions, results and products

target.comment: 50% in year 3, 60% in year 5, 80% from year 7 on.

actual.comment:
Total satisfaction 87,5%,
90,0 % with decisions, 85,0 % with results and 87,5 % with products.
In the latter period, as a result of the strengthening of the project management unit, with 6 additional members, shows that have been more precise decisions in managing the project and the CPP. Respect to the results reflect a slight decrease mainly given for the delay in the start of projects 2 and 3 respectively, and the prolongation of the project 1. In general was observed an improvement in the perception of the management of CPP

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: SLM initiatives in Cuba respond to the results of monitoring and evaluation of programme-wide conditions

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Number of programme-level indicators related to SLM being measured in accordance with plans

target.comment: 80% of CPP indicators and Purpose and Intermediate Objective levels

actual.comment: 100% of the 26 indicators of the CPP for this period were evaluated.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Number of target institutions receiving regular and up to date information on programme-level CPP indicators

target.comment: The 25 members of the core target group receive information on 100% of indicators within 6 months of measure

actual.comment:
The 25 members of the core target group continue to receive updated information on SLM and project progress. Access to information remains continuous through web sites as DeserCuba , InfoGEO part of the M&E system of the CPP as well as to the and the Repository of SLM with the results of national research of science and technology linked to SLM.
40 institutions are receiving and sending information linked to SLM and different aspects on desertification and drough.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Number of institutions which take into account programme-level indicators in their management of initiatives contributing to SLM

target.comment: The 25 members of the core target group

actual.comment: 42 institutions take into account programme-level indicators in their management of initiatives contributing to SLM, this year the University of Pinar del Río, and Villena Technological Institute were incorporated. There are other 8 institutions outside the initial target group and already taken into account in their plans and programs SLM initiatives.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Proportion of annual work plans and budgets which adequately take into account the results of monitoring and evaluation

target.comment: 100% throughout the life of the CPP

actual.comment: (100%) Work plans as well as their budgets have been adapted within the period according to the monitoring and evaluation plan

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Numbers of documents on lessons learnt produced and disseminated within the GEF system, based on project final evaluation reports

target.comment: 5, during the life of the CPP

actual.comment: During the preparation of this report it was being drafted the first document of lessons learned which will be released once it has completed the final of the workshop of project CPP-1.

result.title: Objective
result.description: Globally significant biodiversity in vulnerable ecosystems safeguarded by building capacity at the systemic level to prevent, detect, control, and manage the spread of Invasive Alien Species (IAS) in Cuba

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Increased effectiveness of IAS management framework measured through GEF Tracking tool

baseline.comment: -Total score 1 (out of 29 possible points) (This baseline was recalculated during year 2 of the project)

actual.comment: A score of 24 points

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Increase in area under improved IAS management

baseline.comment: 600 ha under IAS management (baseline defined on year 2)

target.comment: at least 20 000 ha under IAS management (target modified on year 2 - see Adjustments tab)

actual.comment:
4000 HA under IAS Managment during this period
Accumulated total 16,500 ha under IAS Management

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description:
Priority given to BD issues in the prevention, control, and management of IAS, measured by:
-investments in IAS activities by MINAG, MINAL, MITRANS, CITMA y MINSAP
-% of quarantine, risk analysis, and EIAs that incorporate analysis of impact of IAS on BD
-% of management plans that include species recuperation and/or ecosystem restoration and rehabilitation activities

baseline.comment:
- 0% investment in IAS activities by MINAG, MINAL, MITRANS and CITMA at start of project (baseline determined on year 2)
- 0% of quarantine, risk analysis, and EIAs incorporate BD analysis
- 0% of management plans include these activites (baseline determined on year 2)

target.comment:
- 2% increase in IAS specific investment
- 100% of quarantie, risk analysis and EIAs incorporate BD analysis
- 100%of management plans for 26 species include these activities

actual.comment:
2% increase in IAS specific investment (MINAG, bufalos See note on cofinancing on basic data tab)
40% of quarantine, risk analysis, and EIAs incorporate BD analysis
(Accumulated total 60% )
100 % of management plans (42 plans for 27 species) include these activities (two species were added this year the giant african snail and the river mussel)

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Native species addition or status change on IUCN list red list

baseline.comment: - IUCN red list of threatened species for Cuba exists and continually updated

target.comment: no addition or status change to any native species on the red list due to effects of IAS

actual.comment: No addition or status change to any native species on the red list due to effects of IAS

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Operational IAS policy, legal, regulatory, and coordination frameworks that prevent, detect, and manage the spread of IAS and mitigate impact of IAS on biodiversity are strengthened and implemented

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Comprehensive national and sectoral policy and legal framework in place by establishing a national IAS strategy and establishing, updating, and/or complementing the following regulations: black list and gray list, risk analysis, EIA, protocols, normative documents and quarantine mechanisms, monitoring and surveillance, early warning and rapid response system, ballast waters and ship hulls, plant protection/health legislation, and procedures for elaboration of management plans

baseline.comment:
- key IAS regulations do not exist or are outdated
-draft of National IAS strategy
-indicators do not exist to measure compliance with environmental legislation

target.comment:
IAS regulations established, updated and complemented
National IAS strategy approved and 50% planned activities effectively implemented
Methodologies proposed to develop indicators that measure compliance with environmental legislation

actual.comment:
The regulations regarding plant protection by Ministry of Agriculture and Ballast Water by Security and Inspection Maritime Direction that were already elaborated are under implementation
Various legal provisions on Biosafety (related to Living Modified Organisms OVM and Invasive Alien Species) are under review
Methodologies in Risk Analysis and Environmental Impact Assessment, are in implementation, and have been submitted to the CITMA for final approval
The methodology for the lists, black, gray and white has been validated with 16 species (11 pests and 5 species of the project)
The National IAS Strategy was submitted to CITMA for final approval, but due to the internal reorganizatives measures inside the Ministry the Strategy has not yet been approved. However, implementation of the Strategy has begun through the management plans with different activities with productive sector conducted by the project and the inclusion of IAS activities in the National Strategic Plan for Protective Areas 2014-2020
work continues in the identification of indicators to measure the effectiveness of legislation.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Economic incentives and disincentives control the introduction and use of IAS in production sectors and facilitate management of IAS

baseline.comment: - no economic incentives or disincentives regarding IAS exist

target.comment: Three economic incentives or disincentives drafted and approved

actual.comment:
Has increased the application of economic incentives in Melaleuca and Casuarina, applies in Zapata Swamp
(5 total)

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Institutional framework for IAS control between stakeholders and across sectors legally backed

baseline.comment:
- no advisory forum exists
- no coordination group for IAS exists
- no coordination mechanisms between regulatory authorities exist for the implementation and an early warning system and use of IAS information system

target.comment:
An advisory forum exists composed of experts from key sectors
National IAS Subgroup coordinates the development and implementation of IAS National Strategy
Coordination mechanisms for early warning system and information system established between 9 key regulatory authorities and other key actors

actual.comment:
The expert Forum has been formally recognized in the proceedings of the Early Warning System and Rapid Response.
The subgroups of Flora and Fauna are participating in the renovation of the National Biodiversity Strategy
Legal regulations required for the establishment of the coordination mechanism by National Biosafety Centre are being drafted
Under implementation National Coordination Mechanisms for Early Warning System and Rapid Response, with 5 additional species: mejillón verde, araña parda, ácaro rojo, Scaevola cerisia, Curvícola fluminea

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Stakeholder capacity, know-how, and communications are enhanced for effective IAS prevention, detection, and management

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Number of knowledge products developed

baseline.comment:
- standardized methodologies for IAS do not exist
- no IAS information system exists
- no IAS monitoring system exists

target.comment:
Methodologies are standardized and implemented for IAS inventory, ecosystem vulnerability assessments, risk analysis, EIA, economic valuation and cost benefit analysis, and management actions for 26 IAS
IAS Information System designed and includes information regarding species lists, quarantine mechanisms, risk analysis and EIA, early warning response, monitoring and control, management, and coordination between institutions
IAS monitoring system contains baseline information and key indicators

actual.comment:
All methodologies developed and standardized by the project are being implemented in 60 working sites
- Preparation of IAS Inventories
- The development of IAS management programs (Methodological Guidelines)
- Methodological guidelines for economic valuation and cost-benefit analysis.
- Risk analysis
- Environmental Impact Assessment
- The development of species lists.
- Assessing management effectiveness
The IAS Information System was updated and the new data distributed. It is being used as a tool in the 60 working sites and by the national institutions involved.
The Monitoring System continues its application in the working sites and are being edited 8 monitoring protocols
These were the most important activities of the Monitoring System
- The forest rangers corps has prospected the surrounding municipalities near detection points of the giant African snail, without having new reports of sightings in Havana.
- Curvicola fluminea was prospected in various rivers in the provinces of Holguin and Santiago de Cuba, detecting the presence of this specie.
- The main nurseries of the communal services enterprises were monitored detecting the presence of Raioella indica in 90% of these.
- Lionfish monitoring continued throughout the coastal area, with special emphasis on Guanahacabibes and Zapata Swamp

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description:
Increased stakeholder skill-set and knowledge on scientific bases, legal tools and management approaches for IAS control
(Indicators for the success of the training will be developed as part of the programme and incorporated into the project M&E system)

baseline.comment: - low skill-set and knowledge among key stakeholders

target.comment:
Training for and skills applied by
-50 ballast water and ship hull contamination control specialists
-200 specialists in IAS science
-100 specialists in monitoring of IAS applying skills
-30 technicians in GIS trained and applying skills
-800 regulatory authorities, environmental managers, and representatives of the productive sectors trained in current IAS legislation
-60% of inspectors technically qualified to apply IAS regulations
-at least 35% personnel trained are men and 40% of personnel trained are women

actual.comment:
200specialists in IAS science were trained in several topics related to prevention, control and management of IAS(500 Total)
60 specialists were trained in monitoring system(205 Total)
60 specialists were trained in monitoring system (125 Total)
300 specialists from the regulatory system authorities were trained (600)
45% inspectors are considered to be technically qualified on the enforcement of IAS regulations
The targets of having at least 40% of women and 35% of men in training programs have been met

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Increased public knowledge and participation and stakeholder support for IAS prevention, detection, and management

baseline.comment: - low awareness among political leaders, IAS using sectors, schools and public

target.comment: 80% of participants in public awareness campaigns and workshops report increased awareness of threats

actual.comment: 60% of target public groups have increased awareness about IAS impacts and the alternatives for their use

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Institutional capacities are strengthened to ensure the effective implementation of prevention, detection, and management of IAS mitigate their impact on BD and ecosystem services

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: # of penalties enforced related to violation of IAS regulations

actual.comment:
93% (2%decrease during this period)
7% decrease from baseline

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: # of illegal point of entry detections

target.comment: increased # of point of entry detections

actual.comment:
76 (2% increase during this period)
7% increase from baseline

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: # of IAS under monitoring and surveillance as part of early warning system

baseline.comment: - lion fish has incipient early warning system

target.comment: Ten IAS monitored as part of early warning system

actual.comment:
Remain under Early Warning System 7 species declared and the African giant snail adds. (8 in total)
Lionfish under continuous monitoring on all coasts around the country, showing control and population decline in the most of places

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description:
IAS management actions are implemented to eradicate, contain and/or control existing IAS species threatening native flora and fauna in 7 biodiversity critical wildlands and productive areas
(impact indicators for each will be developed as part of the management plan and incorporated into project M&E system)

baseline.comment:
- some management actions implemented
- Perna viridis only in Bay of Cienfuegos

target.comment:
- Management actions implemented for 10 IAS results in reduced predation, loss of habitat, and/or inter-specific competition
-containment of perna viridis within Bay of Cienfuegos
- On-site surveys will be conducted to detect the presence of perna viridis in 10 additional bays, and a strategy for each site where presence of perna viridis is detected will be defined (target added on year 2 - see Adjustment tab)

actual.comment:
Concrete actions corresponding to all of 42 management plans for 27 species are under implementation in 60 working sites. They contain a program of habitat and / or ecosystem restoration that helps reduce habitat lost and inter- specific competition.
Containement of Perna viridis en Cienfuegos
A total of 10 bays have been prospected (4 in this period at the north coast of Cuba: Matanzas, Bahía Honda, Cabañas y Bahía de Cochinos at the south coast with no presence detected of Perna viridis.
In the case of Mariel bay, this specie was found in another sector, corresponding to the new development zone, at this time the expert forum is analyzing the abundance of the species to define management strategies to apply.
Three eradication exercises have been conducted with satisfactory results in the place the species was found, presenting a significant decrease in the population

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Implementation of IAS monitoring system measures effect of management actions and tracks IAS impact on ecosystems, habitats, species, and genetic diversity

baseline.comment: IAS monitoring system is not implemented

target.comment: Management actions for 5 IAS monitored and evaluated and 5 indicators that track IAS impacts on ecosystems, habitats, species, and genetic diversity are measured

actual.comment: Effectiveness methodology is being applied in 15 management programs for 15 species. All these programs were improved for proper application of this methodology. There is a set of indicators corresponding to social, environmental, institutional and economical dimensions for each of the species. First results will be available by the end of the year

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description:
Frequency of use of IAS Information System by key national and local actors:
-regulatory authorities and management experts
-academic and research institutes
-productive sectors
-other sectors

actual.comment:
20% regulatory authorities and management experts
20% academic and research institutes
6% productive sectors
6% other sectors
